meanings.definition: Any of a group of substances that occur in plants and animals and form a constituent of various natural sweeteners and drugs.
meanings.sent1: The herbal medicine contains glycosides that help in treating coughs and colds.
meanings.sent2: Scientists are studying the glycosides found in certain flowers for their potential health benefits.
meanings.sent3: The clever rabbit mixed glycosides with honey to make a magical potion.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was like glycosides, sweet and healing to everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: In the forest, the glycosides in the leaves attracted bees with their natural sweetness.

meanings.definition: A compound that yields a sugar and one or more other products when treated with an acid or other reagent.
meanings.sent1: When the chemist added the acid, the glycosides in the solution reacted to produce sugar.
meanings.sent2: The process of hydrolysis breaks down glycosides into their sugar components.
meanings.sent3: The school science experiment turned into a sticky mess when the glycosides reacted unexpectedly.
meanings.sent4: Her words were like glycosides, breaking down barriers and bringing sweetness to the conversation.
meanings.sent5: The laboratory was filled with the sweet aroma of glycosides as the reaction took place.
